article_title: Photos: France Mourns, Police Corner Charlie Hebdo Suspects
article_text: Armed security forces fly overhead in a military helicopter in Dammartin-en-Goele, France, 30 miles northeast of Paris, on Friday. A huge manhunt for the two suspected gunmen in Wednesday's deadly attack on Charlie Hebdo newspaper has entered its third day, with major police activity surrounding the industrial town where the suspects are reportedly holed up with a hostage. Thibault Camus/AP

article_metadata.title: Photos: France Mourns, Police Corner Charlie Hebdo Suspects

og.description: France and the world mourn the victims of the Paris massacre as events unfold in the manhunt for the suspects.

article_summary:
Armed security forces fly overhead in a military helicopter in Dammartin-en-Goele, France, 30 miles northeast of Paris, on Friday.
A huge manhunt for the two suspected gunmen in Wednesday's deadly attack on Charlie Hebdo newspaper has entered its third day, with major police activity surrounding the industrial town where the suspects are reportedly holed up with a hostage.
Thibault Camus/AP
